channel.title: Graph Convolutional Networks on GradientDissent
channel.description: Recent content in Graph Convolutional Networks on GradientDissent

item.title: Understanding the mathematical foundations and applications of Graph Convolutional Networks
item.description: Recent advances in neural networks have driven study of data mining and pattern recognition. End-to-end deep learning models including convolutional neural networks (CNNs), recurrent neural networks (RNNs), and autoencoders have breathed new life into traditional machine learning tasks such as object detection, machine translation, and speech recognition. Deep Learning is effective at uncovering hidden patterns among Euclidean data (images, text, videos). But what about applications that rely on data originating from non-Euclidean domains, which is typically represented as a graph with intricate interdependencies and relationships among objects?
